name: Lake Eyre
hint: Largest lake in Australia, usually a dry salt flat, lowest point on the continent

name: Lake Taupo
hint: Largest lake in New Zealand, formed by a massive volcanic eruption

name: Lake Torrens
hint: Large salt lake in South Australia, usually dry

name: Lake Gairdner
hint: Large salt lake in South Australia, used for land speed record attempts

name: Lake Alexandrina
hint: Freshwater lake near the mouth of the Murray River in South Australia

name: Lake Argyle
hint: Largest artificial lake in Australia, in Western Australia's Kimberley region

name: Lake Te Anau
hint: Largest lake in the South Island of New Zealand, in Fiordland

name: Lake Waikaremoana
hint: Mountain lake in New Zealand's North Island, in Te Urewera

name: Lake Rotorua
hint: Geothermal lake on New Zealand's North Island, in a volcanic zone

name: Lake Hillier
hint: Distinctive pink-colored lake on an island off Western Australia

name: Lake Wakatipu
hint: Long Z-shaped lake in Otago, New Zealand, at the foot of Queenstown

name: Lake Burley Griffin
hint: Artificial lake at the heart of Canberra, Australia's capital, named after the city's architect

name: Lake Wanaka
hint: Glacial lake in the Otago region of New Zealand, famous for its lone willow tree

name: Lake Disappointment
hint: Dry salt lake in Western Australia named by an explorer who was hoping for fresh water

name: Lake Mackay
hint: Largest lake in the Northern Territory of Australia, an ephemeral salt lake
